tatami.core.agent.messaging

Class MessagingComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • tatami.core.agent.AgentComponent
      • tatami.core.agent.messaging.MessagingComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JadeMessaging, LocalDeploymentPlatform.SimpleLocalMessaging

    public abstract class MessagingComponent
extends AgentComponent
    The messaging component should handle all communication between the agent and other agents. Note that the existence of such a component in the CompositeAgent modifies its behavior: without any messaging component, received messages are notified as agent events to all components of the agent; with it, messages are passed to the messaging component, which then should route them to the appropriate receivers. // TODO: mention this in CompositeAgent.

    The class should be extended by any component that offers to the agent services of communication with other agents. Extending classes should override the parentChangeNotifier method to register an event handler for AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_MESSAGE.

    The communication is abstracted as exchanging messages between endpoints, where each endpoint is identified by a String address composed of multiple elements separated by slashes. This means that an endpoint may be identified by a URI (if the MessagingComponent implementation supports it), or, for instance, by an address of the type "Agent1/Visualization" (this will work with Jade, where agents are addressable by name).

    Messages are sent from an endpoint to another, and contain a String. Specific implementations may parse the string for additional structure.

    The abstract class implements some basic methods for working with slash-delimited addresses, and offers the method for registering message handlers.

    TODO: make this not abstract by implementing a simple local messaging service.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Method Detail

      • getAgentAddress

        public java.lang.String getAgentAddress()
        Gets the address of the agent, as it is specific to the implementation.
        Returns:
        the address of the parent agent, if any; null otherwise.

      • makePath

        public java.lang.String makePath(java.lang.String... elements)
        The method helps producing a local endpoint address, using the address of the agent and several given path elements.
        Parameters:
        elements - - the elements in the path.
        Returns:
        the full path/address.

      • getAgentAddress

        public abstract java.lang.String getAgentAddress(java.lang.String agentName,
                               java.lang.String containerName)
        The method produces the string address of an agent on the same platform, being provided with the agent name and container. // FIXME: what if the container information is out of date.

        This address can subsequently be suffixed with more path elements by using makePathHelper(String, String...).

        Parameters:
        agentName - - the name of the target agent.
        containerName - - the container of the target agent
        Returns:
        the string address of the target agent.

      • extractInternalAddress

        public java.lang.String[] extractInternalAddress(AgentEvent event,
                                        java.lang.String... prefixToRemove)
        The method extracts, from the address of an endpoint inside this agent, the elements of the path, after the address of the agent itself and also eliminating specified prefix elements.
        Parameters:
        event - - the event to extract the address from.
        prefixToRemove - - elements of the prefix to remove from the address.
        Returns:
        the elements that were extracted from the address, following the address of the agent and the specified prefix elements; null if an error occurred (address not in the current agent or prefix elements not part of the address in the specified order).

      • extractContent

        public java.lang.String extractContent(AgentEvent event)
        The method extracts from the message event the content of the message.
        Parameters:
        event - - the event to extract the content from.
        Returns:
        the content of the message.

      • sendMessage

        public abstract boolean sendMessage(java.lang.String target,
                  java.lang.String source,
                  java.lang.String content)
        Sends a message to another agent, according to the specific implementation.
        Parameters:
        target - - the target endpoint of the message.
        source - - the source endpoint of the message.
        content - - the content of the message.
        Returns:
        true if the message was sent successfully.

      • makePathHelper

        public static java.lang.String makePathHelper(java.lang.String start,
                              java.lang.String... elements)
        Produces an address by assembling the start of the address with the rest of the elements. They will be separated by the address separator specified as constant.

        Elements that are null will not be assembled in the path.

        Parameters:
        start - - start of the address.
        elements - - other elements in the address
        Returns:
        the resulting address.
